fields.summary: Unable to allocate an IP address after releasing one using user quotas.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I allocated an IP address using the admin user for account ui-test-acct-00.  I also set a quota of 1 for Elastic IP Addresses to another user.  I then logged in as the user and tried to allocate an IP address.  I was able to allocate an IP address but then, I released the IP address and was not able to allocate another IP address.  Even if I log on as another user with a quota of 1, I can no longer allocate another IP address.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add a user with PowerUser access
2. Create an EC2 quota allowing only one Elastic IP
3. Login as that user and allocate 1 IP address
4. Release the IP address
5. Try to allocate another IP address

Expected Result: You will no longer be able to allocate ANY IP addresses
fields.summary: Elastic IP address user quotas are being applied to multiple users.

comments.body:
I don't understand. I would expect the result to be "you can now allocate another IP".
I tested with an account that had several allocated.
 - I set the quota to 1 IP
 - I logged in as that user
 - I could not allocate another address (due to quota)
 - I released all of the IPs
 - I could then allocate an IP
 - I could not allocate a 2nd IP (due to quota)
[~ccassler] Aren't eips shared among users in an account just like other resources in the account?
When counting address usage we currently always match on the account, we should only count addresses owned by the user for a user quota. The fix for this is small and local to address quotas.
To verify we should test address quotas for a user and also for an account.

[~sjones]: Currently, I do not have a quota setup for the account that I have the user quota for.  So in this case, the quota for all users should be open except for whatever quota I set for users.

I tried another quick test where I set an account quota of 2 and tried allocating IP addresses using the admin user which does not have a limit.  I was only able to allocate 1 IP address.
Is the correct behavior to have IP addresses that were allocated by other users shared with the user quota?  That is what's happening in all cases here.

[~ccassler], the expected behaviour is that user quotas apply only to the user they belong to and do not impact others users quotas. An account quota applies to the set of all users in the account (i.e. is shared) and can mean a user is not able to utilize their full user specific quota (if any). Please verify that the fix is in place on the cloud being used for testing.

[~sjones]: The latest test I did was this:

1. I set a quota to user-1 of 4 maximum Elastic IP addresses.
2. I set another quota of 2 maximum Elastic IP addresses to user-2.
3. I logged in as user-2 and allocated 2 IP addresses and could not add more as expected.  I left the IP addresses allocated and logged out as that user.
4. I logged in as user-1 and was able to allocate 4 more IP addresses to have a total of 6.  That was also good.
5. However, as user-1, I then released 1 address and tried to add another one.  It wouldn't let me allocate another address after releasing it.  I tried this numerous times.  Sometimes it would allow me and sometimes it wouldn't.  I know that when I wasn't able to allocate an address, I tried to release more addresses but I was still not able to allocate another address until the total number of allocated addresses was below my quota.  I would think this is not acceptable because it just wasn't calculating the addresses I allocated, it was calculating addresses that other users allocated as well.
[~ccassler], if you cannot allocate an address minutes after releasing the previous address then please open a separate bug for that issue.
[~sjones]: Please see my updated comments above.
[~ccassler], I do not see that behaviour. Please open a separate issue with full details on how to reproduce using euca2ools.
Opened a different bug related to this one.
[~ccassler], this issue was a valid bug and there is a fix committed for it in 4.1.
[~sjones]: Ah, OK.  I will reopen and change move to QA.
[~sjones]: Actually, can you resolve it and assign i to me so I can verify the fix?  Thanks.

Verified.  I tried the steps in the bug and was not able to reproduce.
